original: a'arya n'a ma sam g'i ti s'a dha nam /
analyzed: a'arya n'a ma sam g'i ti s'a dha nam /
translated: Ārya-nāmasamgīti-sādhana

original: bod skad du /
analyzed: bod skad du /
translated: In Tibetan:

original: 'phags pa mtshan yang dag par brjod pa'i sgrub thabs /
analyzed: 'phags pa mtshan yang dag par brjod pa'i sgrub thabs /
translated: Ārya-mañjuśrī-nama-saṃgīti-sādhana

original: 'phags pa 'jam dpal la phyag 'tshal lo //
analyzed: 'phags pa 'jam dpal la phyag 'tshal lo //
translated: Homage to Ārya Mañjuśrī.

original: dang por re zhig sgrub pa pos snga bar langs te kha bsang ba la sogs pa byas te bsam gtan gyi khang par rab tu zhugs nas stan bde ba la skyil mo krung gis nye bar 'dug ste /
analyzed: dang por re zhig sgrub pa pos snga bar langs te kha bsang ba la sogs pa byas te bsam gtan gyi khang par rab tu zhugs nas stan bde ba la skyil mo krung gis nye bar 'dug ste /
translated: First, the practitioner should rise early, perform oral purification, and so forth, then enter the meditation hut and sit cross-legged on a comfortable seat.

original: snying gar padma dang zla ba la dmar zhing dkar ba'i mu:yig bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: snying gar padma dang zla ba la dmar zhing dkar ba'i mu:yig bsgom par bya'o //
translated: At the heart, on a lotus and moon, visualize a red and white MU syllable.

original: de nas de'i 'od zer gyi tshogs lcags kyu'i rnam pa can gyis bkug ste 'chad par 'gyur ba'i bcom ldan 'das sku mdog dang zhal dang phyag mtshan dang stan dang ldan pa mdun du rnam par bsgoms nas /
analyzed: de nas de'i 'od zer gyi tshogs lcags kyu'i rnam pa can gyis bkug ste 'chad par 'gyur ba'i bcom ldan 'das sku mdog dang zhal dang phyag mtshan dang stan dang ldan pa mdun du rnam par bsgoms nas /
translated: Then, with a mass of light rays in the form of hooks, invite the Blessed One with the described body color, faces, hand implements, and seat, and visualize him in front.

original: yid kyis rang bzhin gyi me tog dang / bdug spos la sogs pas yang dag par mchod la de'i mdun du sdig pa bshags pa la @124b sogs pa thams cad byas nas byams pa la sogs pa tshad med pa'i gnas bzhi bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: yid kyis rang bzhin gyi me tog dang / bdug spos la sogs pas yang dag par mchod la de'i mdun du sdig pa bshags pa la @124b sogs pa thams cad byas nas byams pa la sogs pa tshad med pa'i gnas bzhi bsgom par bya'o //
translated: Having made offerings with mental flowers, incense, and so forth, one should confess all one's sins in front of that [Buddha], and so forth, and one should cultivate the four immeasurables, beginning with loving kindness.

original: chos thams cad stong pa nyid mngon du bya'o //
analyzed: chos thams cad stong pa nyid mngon du bya'o //
translated: One should realize the emptiness of all phenomena.

original: aom sh'u n+ya t'a dzny'a na badzra sva bh'a ba a'atma ko& ham zhes pa'i sngags kyis byin gyis brlab par bya'o //
analyzed: aom sh'u n+ya t'a dzny'a na badzra sva bh'a ba a'atma ko& ham zhes pa'i sngags kyis byin gyis brlab par bya'o //
translated: One should bless oneself with the mantra, “Oṃ śūnyatā-jñāna-vajra-svabhāvātmako ’haṃ. ”

original: de nas nam mkha' la h'um gi yi ge rdo rje rtse lnga pa'i sa bon dang bcas pa bsgoms la /
analyzed: de nas nam mkha' la h'um gi yi ge rdo rje rtse lnga pa'i sa bon dang bcas pa bsgoms la /
translated: Then, one should visualize in space the syllable hūṃ, which is the seed of the five-pronged vajra.

original: de'i 'od zer rnams kyis ji ltar spyod pa'i rdo rje'i ra ba dang / rdo rje'i gur dang / rdo rje'i rang bzhin gyi sa gzhir dmigs nas /
analyzed: de'i 'od zer rnams kyis ji ltar spyod pa'i rdo rje'i ra ba dang / rdo rje'i gur dang / rdo rje'i rang bzhin gyi sa gzhir dmigs nas /
translated: One should visualize that its light rays create a vajra fence, a vajra tent, and a vajra ground, which are the places where one practices.

original: rdo rje'i rang bzhin las 'od zer byung bas rdo rje'i ra ba'i phyi rol du phyogs bcings pa la sogs pa'i gzugs kyis nye bar gnas par blta'o //
analyzed: rdo rje'i rang bzhin las 'od zer byung bas rdo rje'i ra ba'i phyi rol du phyogs bcings pa la sogs pa'i gzugs kyis nye bar gnas par blta'o //
translated: Light rays come from the nature of the vajra, and one should see that they abide in the form of binding the directions outside the vajra fence.

original: de'i rjes su rdo rje ra ba'i nang du hr'i:yongs su gyur pa las padma'o /
analyzed: de'i rjes su rdo rje ra ba'i nang du hr'i:yongs su gyur pa las padma'o /
translated: After that, inside the vajra fence, one should visualize a lotus from the transformation of hriḥ.

original: padma'i steng du aa yig las zla ba'i dkyil 'khor /
analyzed: padma'i steng du aa yig las zla ba'i dkyil 'khor /
translated: On the lotus, from the letter a, is a moon maṇḍala.

original: de'i steng du kha dog dkar dmar gyi mu:yig las sangs rgyas dpag tu med pa spro ba dang bsdu ba'i rnam par bsgoms la /
analyzed: de'i steng du kha dog dkar dmar gyi mu:yig las sangs rgyas dpag tu med pa spro ba dang bsdu ba'i rnam par bsgoms la /
translated: On that, from the letter muḥ, which is red and white, one should meditate on the emanation and gathering of immeasurable buddhas.

original: de yongs su gyur pa las rje btsun 'jam dpal dmar zhing dkar ba padma dang zla ba'i steng du rdo rje skyil mo krung gis bzhugs pa /
analyzed: de yongs su gyur pa las rje btsun 'jam dpal dmar zhing dkar ba padma dang zla ba'i steng du rdo rje skyil mo krung gis bzhugs pa /
translated: From the transformation of that, the venerable Mañjuśrī is red and white, sitting in the vajra posture on a lotus and moon.

original: dang po'i zhal dmar po /🔽g-yas pa sngon po /
analyzed: dang po'i zhal dmar po / g-yas pa sngon po /
translated: The first face is red.🔽The right face is blue.

original: g-yon pa dkar po zhes pa'i zhal gsum mo //
analyzed: g-yon pa dkar po zhes pa'i zhal gsum mo //
translated: The left face is white.

original: phyag bzhis ji lta ba'i sbyor bas shes rab kyi po ti ngang /
analyzed: phyag bzhis ji lta ba'i sbyor bas shes rab kyi po ti ngang /
translated: With the four hands, as is the case, one should hold a wisdom sword and a lotus.

original: ral gri dang / gzhu dang / mda' bsnams pa'o //
analyzed: ral gri dang / gzhu dang / mda' bsnams pa'o //
translated: He holds a sword, a bow, and an arrow.

original: rin po che'i dgu rgyan can /
analyzed: rin po che'i dgu rgyan can /
translated: He is adorned with the nine ornaments of a lord.

original: mtshan bzang po sum cu rtsa gnyis dang dpe byad brgyad cus rnam par mdzes pa /
analyzed: mtshan bzang po sum cu rtsa gnyis dang dpe byad brgyad cus rnam par mdzes pa /
translated: He is beautiful with the thirty-two auspicious signs and the eighty marks.

original: gzhon zhing gzhon nu'i rgyan gyis brgyan pa'i bdag nyid du bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: gzhon zhing gzhon nu'i rgyan gyis brgyan pa'i bdag nyid du bsgom par bya'o //
translated: He is youthful, and he is adorned with the ornaments of a youth.

original: snying gar padma dang zla ba'i steng du sems dpa'i skyil krung gis bzhugs pa'i sems ma dkar mo g-yon pa dril bu dkur brten pa /
analyzed: snying gar padma dang zla ba'i steng du sems dpa'i skyil krung gis bzhugs pa'i sems ma dkar mo g-yon pa dril bu dkur brten pa /
translated: In the heart, on a lotus and moon, is white Citta, in the sattva posture, with a bell resting on her hip.

original: g-yas pa rang gi snying gar 'degs par byed pa'i sbyor bas rdo rje 'chang ba /
analyzed: g-yas pa rang gi snying gar 'degs par byed pa'i sbyor bas rdo rje 'chang ba /
translated: With her right hand she makes the gesture of raising to her heart, holding a vajra.

original: smin mtshams su de bzhin du bzhugs pa'i rin chen rdo rje ma ser mo phyag gnyis kyis spyi bor me tog gi phreng ba 'ching bar mdzad pa'o //
analyzed: smin mtshams su de bzhin du bzhugs pa'i rin chen rdo rje ma ser mo phyag gnyis kyis spyi bor me tog gi phreng ba 'ching bar mdzad pa'o //
translated: In the same way, at the brow is yellow Ratnavajrā, with both hands at the crown of the head, holding a garland of flowers.

original: mgrin par padma rdo rje ma dkar dmar g-yon pas snying po dang bcas pa'i padma'i sdong bu 'dzin pa g-yas pas de'i 'dab ma rnam par 'byed par mdzad pa sngon ma ji lta ba bzhin du bzhugs pa'o //
analyzed: mgrin par padma rdo rje ma dkar dmar g-yon pas snying po dang bcas pa'i padma'i sdong bu 'dzin pa g-yas pas de'i 'dab ma rnam par 'byed par mdzad pa sngon ma ji lta ba bzhin du bzhugs pa'o //
translated: At the throat is white and red Vajra Lotus, holding a lotus stalk with a heart and opening its petals with the right hand, just as before.

original: spyi bor las kyi rdo rje ma sku mdog ljang gu rdo rje rtse gsum dang ldan pa'i phyag gnyis bdag nyid kyi spyi bor 'chang bar mdzad cing de kho na bzhin du gnas par bsgom par bya'o //🔽aom badzra aam ku sha dza:/🔽aom badzra @125a * //🔽p'a sha h'um /🔽aom badzra spho ta bam /
analyzed: spyi bor las kyi rdo rje ma sku mdog ljang gu rdo rje rtse gsum dang ldan pa'i phyag gnyis bdag nyid kyi spyi bor 'chang bar mdzad cing de kho na bzhin du gnas par bsgom par bya'o // aom badzra aam ku sha dza:/ aom badzra @125a * // p'a sha h'um / aom badzra spho ta bam /
translated: On the crown of the head is green Karma Vajrī, holding a three-pronged vajra in both hands above her head, and just like that, she is visualized.

original: aom badzra a'a be sha ho: zhes pa'i sngags kyis padma dang zla ba'i steng du go rims ji lta ba bzhin du ye shes kyi 'khor lo dgug pa dang / gzhug pa dang / bcing ba dang / dbang du bya'o //
analyzed: aom badzra a'a be sha ho: zhes pa'i sngags kyis padma dang zla ba'i steng du go rims ji lta ba bzhin du ye shes kyi 'khor lo dgug pa dang / gzhug pa dang / bcing ba dang / dbang du bya'o //
translated: With the mantras oṃ vajra aṃ kuśa jaḥ, oṃ vajra pāśa hūṃ, oṃ vajra sphoṭa vaṃ, and oṃ vajra āveśa hoḥ, the wheel of awareness is invited, caused to enter, bound, and controlled, just as before, upon the lotus and moon.

original: rdo rje khu tshur gnyis bcings te /
analyzed: rdo rje khu tshur gnyis bcings te /
translated: Form the two vajra fists

original: mdzub mo dang mthe'u chung rnams lcags sgrog tu byas te sprad pa gan rgyal du rang gi khar gzhag pa ni rdo rje 'khor lo'i phyag rgya'o //
analyzed: mdzub mo dang mthe'u chung rnams lcags sgrog tu byas te sprad pa gan rgyal du rang gi khar gzhag pa ni rdo rje 'khor lo'i phyag rgya'o //
translated: The index and little fingers are locked together and placed in one's mouth, face down. This is the mudra of the vajra wheel.

original: mchod yon dang / zhabs bsil dang / me tog dang / bdug spos la sogs pa rnams kyis yang dag par mchod nas skad cig gis rang gi lus la gzhug par bya'o //
analyzed: mchod yon dang / zhabs bsil dang / me tog dang / bdug spos la sogs pa rnams kyis yang dag par mchod nas skad cig gis rang gi lus la gzhug par bya'o //
translated: Having made offerings with water for the feet, water for the mouth, flowers, incense, and so forth, one should instantly enter one's own body.

original: de'i rjes su de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyis dbang bskur ba sngon du 'gro bas mi bskyod pas dbu brgyan pa'i bdag nyid du rnam par bsam par bya'o //
analyzed: de'i rjes su de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyis dbang bskur ba sngon du 'gro bas mi bskyod pas dbu brgyan pa'i bdag nyid du rnam par bsam par bya'o //
translated: After that, one should visualize oneself as being crowned by Akshobhya, preceded by the empowerment of all the tathagatas.

original: aom sarba dharm'a:sva bh'a ba bi shuddha badzra tsakshu aa a'a aam a'a:pra kri ti pa ri shuddha:sarba dharm'a ya du ta sarba ta th'a ga ta dzny'a na k'a ya manydzu shr'i pa ri shuddhi t'a mu p'a d'a ya ti aa a'a:sarba ta th'a ga ta hri da ya
analyzed: aom sarba dharm'a:sva bh'a ba bi shuddha badzra tsakshu aa a'a aam a'a:pra kri ti pa ri shuddha:sarba dharm'a ya du ta sarba ta th'a ga ta dzny'a na k'a ya manydzu shr'i pa ri shuddhi t'a mu p'a d'a ya ti aa a'a:sarba ta th'a ga ta hri da ya
translated: Om, all phenomena are pure by nature, the vajra eye, a a a a, the natural purity of all phenomena, the light of all tathagatas, is purified by the vajra of the mind of all tathagatas.

original: ha ra ha ra /
analyzed: ha ra ha ra /
translated: Hara hara.

original: aom h'um hr'i: bha ga b'an dzny'a na m'urti w'a g'i shva ra ma h'a w'a tsa sarba dharma ga ga na aa ma la su pa ri shuddha dharma dh'a tu dzny'a na garbha a'a:zhes pa'i sngags kyis dang po dang bar dang mthar byin gyis brlab pa sngon du
analyzed: aom h'um hr'i: bha ga b'an dzny'a na m'urti w'a g'i shva ra ma h'a w'a tsa sarba dharma ga ga na aa ma la su pa ri shuddha dharma dh'a tu dzny'a na garbha a'a:zhes pa'i sngags kyis dang po dang bar dang mthar byin gyis brlab pa sngon du
translated: With the mantra Oṃ hūṃ hrīḥ bhagavān jñānamūrti vāgīśvara mahāvāca sarvadharma gagana-ama la supāriśuddha dharma-dhātu jñāna garbha āḥ, first, in the middle, and at the end, one should bless the place, and so on.

original: 'gro ba'i rje btsun mtshan yang dag par brjod pa nyi ma so so la so so'i thun mtshams la lan gsum mam lan grangs du mar skyil mo krung ma bshig par ting nge 'dzin dang ldan pa'i mkhas pas bklag par bya'o //
analyzed: 'gro ba'i rje btsun mtshan yang dag par brjod pa nyi ma so so la so so'i thun mtshams la lan gsum mam lan grangs du mar skyil mo krung ma bshig par ting nge 'dzin dang ldan pa'i mkhas pas bklag par bya'o //
translated: Then, the wise one, endowed with samādhi, should read the Praise in the presence of the sun, three times or many times, without uncrossing the legs, during each session.

original: de bzhin du ji srid dngos grub kyi mtshan ma mthong gi bar de srid du bsgom zhing bklag par bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du ji srid dngos grub kyi mtshan ma mthong gi bar de srid du bsgom zhing bklag par bya'o //
translated: In the same way, one should meditate and read until one sees the signs of siddhi.

original: de'i rjes su rgyud ji lta ba bzhin du dngos grub kyi thabs la rjes su gnas par bya'o zhes so //
analyzed: de'i rjes su rgyud ji lta ba bzhin du dngos grub kyi thabs la rjes su gnas par bya'o zhes so //
translated: After that, one should abide in the means of siddhi according to the tantra.

original: 'phags pa mtshan yang dag par brjod pa'i sgrub thabs rdzogs so//
analyzed: 'phags pa mtshan yang dag par brjod pa'i sgrub thabs rdzogs so//
translated: The Sādhana of the Noble One's True Name is complete.
